text: Bottle - Funk, farmhouse and light petroleum. Clearish gold. White grape, green apple and nice tartness.

2013 vintage bottle [at Ryans during 2016 and again at As Is 2017]. Pours a deep, hazy orange body with light wispy white head. Nose is fruity, oaky and sour; lots of tart orange, peach, apricot and grapefruit. Mouthfeel is medium bodied; both soft and bright with a nice balance between the fruit character, oak and general sourness; additional notes of lactic funk, grapefruit/pomelo, soft wood flavor towards the back end, sour lemons and farm funk. Really great stuff, would like to try this back-to-back against the regular gueuze.
Bottle, thanks to some random Americans! Pours hazy gold, nose is funky and fruity, apricot, Peach, white grapes, lemon. Palate is smooth grapefruit, citrus, orange, some sour apples. Really good.

March 2017 - 750ml bottle by myself at Cantillon  forced to drink until I literally bled by the no takeaway policy! As Cantillon Lou Pepe Gueuze. Short review with Teresa. Golden orange, translucent and hazy, big foamy beige head. Aroma is cider, mixed apple, some oak. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste follows aroma with tangy soured fruits, cider, mixed citrus, oak, not that acidic at all. With air it gets more of a fruit salad / fruit pastilles vibe in the aroma. Nice. (4.1)

Shared from bottle at home. Hazy golden with thin white head. Begins with some sweet malts, minerallike salt, dried grass, lukewarm horseblanket, light caramel fudge, grapes, light dried apricot, sweaty armpit, hints of sack, nutmeg, wood (the tree kind), cobwebs, sometimes faint hints of aluminum. Light sweet, light sour, moderate mineral salty, moderate almond bitter. Medium body, soft carbonation. Very very smooth for a gueuze. Thin silky feel, soft carbonation.

Bottle shared. Hazy orange golden with small off white head that leaves a nice ring of cute baby bubbles. Lots of funk and fruit! Apricot, apple, lemon, dust, hay, light goat, apple skins, soft yoghurt, vanilla, white grapes. Light oxidized and vineous, quite some old lambic character. Light sweet and itter with light tannic bitter finish. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Really good!

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2017 Bottle poured into a snifter showing hazy orange with clean white foam lacing. 

The nose shows acetic tones with hints of peach and horse blanket. 

The palate is medium bodied and moderately but very gently carbonated. Moderate vanilla background throughout and moderately tart. Flavors of light horse blanket and bretty funk. Light fruit flavors of grapefruit and apricot. Light grapefruit zesty bitterness on finish. Give this a few years and this will be amazing.

btl from 2002, fantastic beer, wasnt sure if it was going to still be good but it held up and mellowed well. pours hazy orange/yellow. fizzy white head that is gone quick. nose is funky, lemon barnyard. flavour is much smoother then i expected. really nice.

A: Hazy yellow/orange coloured with a white head that dissapates relatively fast N: Grapefruit, lemon, orange zest, green apples and oak. T: Oak, grapefruit zest, red apples, funk O: Love the complexity and the flavours on this! Really nice beer!
UPDATED: JAN 29, 2017 Thx chris. Shared w crider, chris, and goof and 2nd shift. Smells like urine. Very tart. Puckering.  Its spritzy, but it also seems off.
Semi hazy golden liquid, small head. Aroma of oak, sour, fruity. Light body, little bit carbonation. Taste is sour and fruity.

From notes. Enjoyed at a tasting Kyle finally made it to at Mickeys on December 01. 750 mL bottle, 2013 sticker. The pour is as nice as you could hope. There is a light hazy golden yellow with a thick white head and some soapy lace as it falls down. The aroma is tart and sour citrus, funky barnyard, a light oak, a hint of brett, but this is just so balanced and delicate. The flavor is just as good. The light and delicate complexity I just love. The funky barnyard isnt as heavy, the citrus is heavy and sour, there is a light dusty hay that just beings it all together. The mouth feel is a little softer than I was hoping. The carbonation isnt as bright as I would like to see and the aftertaste is good, lingering funky sour fruit skins. I like this one.

One of those beers Ive been putting off rating since forever. One of my absolute favourite of the style too. 2011 sticker: Colour is almost clear and rusty orange with a few white islands of foam. The nose is fruity with some gewurztraminer notes. Sweet and mineral with some walnuts and bretty funk. Taste: good lord! So ballanced and mellow and yet pungent with sour apples and zesty pear, bretty funk. Aftertaste has juicy plum and soft citrus and lingering mineral dryness. Perfect if you ask me.
Bottle: Poured a golden with a film head. Aroma is funky dirty. Very funky tart malt.

03/12/2016 @home - 75cl bottle from the brewery.
Cloudy orange with big white head. Nose is sour, hay, citrus. Taste is some green apple, citrus, soft sour, funky
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Jedno z najlepszych gueuze jakie piłem. Wersja 2003, po 13 latach leżakowania w butelce - totalnie niesamowita.
Yellow, small-medium head, fruity aroma, brett, vanilla, green tea, oak, excellent, sour flavor, fruity, green tea, oak, fresh, fruity, sour, lemon, vinaigrette, medium bodied.

2013 flaska @sbwf16. Guldfärgad utan skum för min del. Sur, sträv, torr, citrus, ljus malt, gräs. Riktigt fin och trevlig!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2011 bottle shared at Sovereign on 2/11/16. Clear gold with small offwhite head in a tumbler. Funky wet hay, barnyard, tart citrus peel, yeast, grains.. Phenomenal nose. Finishes dry. Excellent.
750 ml. bottle. Pours a mostly clear gold with a small white head. Aroma of fruit, funk, and wood. Taste is tart fruit, citrus, funk, and wood. Nice tartness. Excellent.
Bottle shared at Zwanze day. Clear golden pour. Aroma is amazing, crazy good funky Gueze. Taste follows, really smooth, freaking awesome.

750 mL bottle. 2010 sticker. Originally reviewed 10/24/2014.

Hazy orange body. Nice white head. Thick collar and some nice surface wisps.
Lots of citrus on the nose. Lemony. Very spritzy. Some dry grass and a bit of a metallic aroma.

Tastes much more dynamic. The citrus is lemony and orangey. Pale malt is stronger. Very woody. Dried grass. Woody finish.

High carbonation. Moderate sourness. Medium light body.

My white whale. An excellent Gueuze. I think Id take a 3F over it, but its remarkable.

Clear golden color with a bit of white head. Aroma has nice farmhouse funk but overall its quite clean. Taste starts sour with lots of barnyard notes like hay, grass and a bit of dusty wood barrels. Light body but not very dry, medium carbonation. Overall its a really good gueuze but the classic Cantillon gueuze is as good as this one.

A 750ml bottle at Nüetnigenough. 2013 sticker, bottled on 27th April 2015. Poured into a Cantillon tasting glass. It poured a clear golden colour with a one finger white head that dissipated fairly quickly and left some sparse lacing. Aromas of apple, floral, lemon, hay, grass, barnyard with a touch of light funk. Tastes quite similar to the aromas with apple, lemon, grass, hay, floral, sour, light vinegar and funk. Light to medium bodied with high to moderate carbonation. Overall a great gueuze. Loving the Lou Pepe varieties from Cantillon. A refreshing spritzy gueuze that is very easy to drink.
2012 Bottle Pours a light yellow color clear with jk head. Apricot and green apple nose. Apricot flavor, green apples, grass, short sweet finish.

Bottle, 75cL. @Naintré with my dad. A yellow orange hazy beer with a medium white head ; small retention. Wood, fruits (apple, peach), light barnyard. Medium dry lasting sour refreshing, light sweet. Light to medium body, thin texture, soft carbonation, dry acid fruity finish. Overall, a delicious sharp fruity sour beer ; easier to drink than most Cantillon without loosing character.

Bottle shared. Thanks Raul! Big funky farmhouse nose with musty notes, leather, wet hay, gooseberry and oak. Taste is more of the same. Complex and changing as it warms. Good carbonation with a nice hint of oaky creaminess on the palate. Finish is dry and quite funky. Amazing.
Duft frisk funk syrlig lidt æble cider frisk citrus. Smag citrus lime æble frisk syrlig tør lidt græs kant

750ml bottle picked up at the brewery. Pours out a golden topped with a ring of a fizzy head. Nose is big cantillon house funk barnyard leather horse blanket wet hay. Taste is more of the big funk barnyard leather horse blanket some fruit notes and a amazing end.

Clear golden color, minimal white head. Lemon, funk, and floral aroma. Wonderful balance of lightly bitter and tart flavors. Almost potent taste despite the low abv. Good carb, light body, and a crisp finish.
Bottle @ Cantillon, Brussels 20160507. [ Vintage 2013 ]. Fruity, bretty and woody, light to medium body with a watery texture. The finish is dry, fruity and woody. A really nice one.
Medium to dark gold in color. Pours with a small head. Nose is funky with gueuze notes and champagne.

750 ml bottle from BeerLovers Vienna, vintage 2013 bottled 27. April 2015.
Dark golden to amber, moderate hazy body, with a medium, fizzy, fluffy, off-white head.
Aroma of barnyard, cheese, green apples, pears, wood, some ripe fruits, vinegar.
Taste is dry, sour and tart, but still well balanced, with wood, unripe pears, lots of green apples, sour citrus, funk, vinegar, some cheese, some basement.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes sour, dry, wooden, fruity, with pears, citrus, some cheese, long-lasting green apples.

Tasty. Straight, but complex at the same time, well balanced, with a lot of lovely sour fruits, especially distinct green apples. World-class and fresh to drink, not really hard to finish the whole 0.75 l bottle, but still not my favourite Cantillon.
Aroma is green apple and some cherry. Tastes tart and a lot like a dry white wine. Pours light yellow with a thin white head. Had at Kaser. Loved it.

A medium dark golden with a bit of white head on the surface. Smells of sour candy, soap, lemon, tannic, a bit of the stinky cheesey hops. Taste has a chemical sourness, sour candy, sour fruit, dry wood, vinegar. Mildly dry, refreshing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Yellow golden color with solid foam layer. The smell is edgy sour and has the typical funk. The taste is surprisingly bitter, dry, dusty and sour. It tastes like cellar (without a specific definition of the taste "cellar"). Light fruity sweetness in the finish. Gingery aggressive spicy, bitter and a little sweet aftertaste.

Bottle, courtesy of King_Alex_II, 2011 vintage. Good funk, quite bitter throughout. Crisply carbonated and a bit fruity. Pineapple? Lasting bitter finish. Not quite as balanced as top tier lambics, but still a very good one.

Bottle, bought at the brewery a while ago with Mike Morse, shared at Moncada with Mes and Simone and Angelo. Thanks for an awesome birthday!

Soo much damn bloody funk! Huge acid. Huge tart. Puckering in the best way possible. No bullshit extract sweetness here. This is exactly how lambic should be done. Jean-PIerre is giving us a masterclass in brewing here. Simply astounding.

Bottle, 2011 vintage. Light hazy orange color, white head. Aroma of barnyard, leather, basement, wine vinegar, hay. Very nice and rustique. Taste is very dry, medium sour with some bitter notes. Flavor is barnyard, leather, lemon, zest, grapes, goosberry, wine vinegar. Aftertaste is dry and tart. Nice body and smooth texture. Very good lambic.

75cl bottle. Golden orange with a short-lasting white head. Smells like vinegar, macerated grapes, barnyard funk. Sour taste all the way, with interesting notes of mould, barnyard funk, apple vinegar and grape juice.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2016 Pale yellow colour. Modest head. Vinegar, grass wine wood. White wine, grass, wood in first taste. Apples, sourness in the middle. Sour finish. Very well balanced, light bodied, sour, refreshing beer. 

Lou Pepe 2013. 750ml bottle. Hazy, golden yellow colour. Woody, acidic, spicy aroma. Also barnyard, lots of citrusses. Juicy. Citrussy at first. Woody, acidic. Citrussy, spicy finish. Oakiness, earthy notes in the aftertaste. Phenomenal.

Bottle I opened from a long lost trade. 2008 sticker, 2011 cork. Pours a slightly hazy yellow with massive white head. Aroma is champagne, oats and app. Taste is dried fruit, sharp sour notes, wood, leather, oak. Nice.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: 2011 bottle at Vienna tasting February 2016. Thanks! Moderately hazy orange colour. Nicely fruity aroma with apricot, alci complex buggery, very inviting. Taste is moderately sour, not harsh at all, slightly cheesy, fruity, pretty complex. Very good.

0,75l bottle at home at Vienna Tasting. Vintage 2011, Bottled 01/2014. light orange rather hazy color, small white head. smells of green apples, nutty, marzipan, some funk, light leather. nice smell. medium body, quite bubbly carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of green apples, some funk, leather, citric, nutty, marzipan, finishes rather sour and quite dry with with notes of marzipan and green apples. good one, sour but I had more sour Cantillons, good stuff.

Bottle kindly shared by Werckmeister, many thanks! 2014 bottle. Pours cloudy orange with fizzy white head. A little grainy aroma with funk, wood, citrus, horse blankets. Taste is apples, citrus, vinegar, oak and lemon zest. Funky, dry finish with lemon.

Bottle kindly shared by Werckmeister, many thanks. Vintage 20011. Hazy golden color with thick white head. Grainy, sour aroma with vinous notes,funk, horse blanket, wood. Sour taste, oak, vinous notes, chees, wood, bayrnard. Tasty.

2015 Vintage bought at brewery and consumed at home. FEB/2016.

AROMA: Mellow, citric, cheesy. 

APPEARANCE: Golden with amber hue. Large white foamy head which quickly dissapates. Not hugely bubbly but when roused it forms a creamy white head which again quickly dissapates.

TASTE: Incredible, INCREDIBLE. Comparable to the standard gueuze but oakier, more mellowed and balanced. Everything I get from the standard gueuze is just amped up yet somehow so much more complex. I could compare this to a 8 year vintage gueuze I drank recently.I would love to see what time can do to this.

PALATE: Sour but not overpowering. Carbonated but not overly so. Funky yet clean. Complex! 

OVERALL: This is the third time I have had this now and each time it gets better. For me the best available gueuze out there. I would love to try it aged. Highly recommended.

Intense dry fruity with some nice Apple cider notes, apricot, oak wooden notes, medium acidity, tart on the palate, lovely. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2011. Bottle thanks to Niall. Pours slightly hazy golden. Aroma is sour, leather, citrus acids, oak, fruits. Taste is sour and very dry, wood, lingering bitter, dry and leathery finish.

Bottle thanks to McNeillR.
Appearance - golden orange and slightly hazy. Decent head.
Nose - a bit meaty and then sour apples and citrus comes through.
Taste - incredibly dry like granny smith skins.
Palate - close to medium bodied with a tangy texture and a long dry tangy finish.
Overall - like a really strong still scrumpy. Tasty.
From bottle (in basket!). Pours hazy gold. Nose is funky, orange peel. Taste is very dry, citrus, yeast. Full-bodied.
Bottle at appellation. Pours hazy golden, nose is funky horseblanket, vanilla, oak, taste is quite dry, horseblanket, light fruit, oak, little harsh.

Bottle at Comely Bankers II. Thanks to McNeillR. 2011 vintage. Pours hazy golden orange with a thin white head. Aromas of barnyard funk, cider apples, lemon and vinegar. Taste is sharp, lemon, cider. Bone dry finish.
UPDATED: MAR 1, 2016 De geur en de smaak is misschien wel hetgeen wat mij het meeste zal bijblijven. Flessen onderling kunnen qua smaak wel verschillen maar het bier zelf is zoooo ontzettend top!

Bottle. Pours light cloudy holden, no head at all. Aroma is very sour and leathery. Deep, sweet, peach, stone fruit, tart wheat, hay, lemon, barnyard. Some sherry and some wood. Very complex. Taste is really sour, leather, nutty, caramel, tart wheat, sour lemon, wood, vanilla, grapefruit, peach. Sparkling carbonation, yet really oily and dry finish. Very very good.

Bottle from 2010 shared at In de Verzekering tegen de Grote Dorst, Lennik - BE. Color: hazy golden blond beer with no carbonation and no foam. Smell: floral and grassy. Fruity notes and sourness. Taste: amazing bouquet, really floral and herbal. This gueuze is really amazing. Good sourness and superb equilibrium. Good attenuation. Aftertaste: sourness and acidity, floral finish.

Bottle 2008 sticker shared by Stigs at big Gaucho bottle share. Pours a cloudy pale golden yellow with a very slight white head. Aromas of vinegar, lemon, cheesy funk, mineral water, wet rocks, wet hay. Damn this smells great. Nothing is over the top. Taste is medium acidity, very well balanced. Finishes extremely clean. Nothing lingers. Just awesome.

2008 vintage. Cloudy orange beer, thin lacy head. Highly complex aroma. Lots of lemony/grapefruity acidity, peculair perfumy notes and deep oakiness at first. Later red currants, leafy tobacco/earthy notes, musty grapafruit juice, leather and wood. Super dry but somewhat malty for a gueuze. Sour wheat bread notes. Loads of grapefruity acids and lactic sour/red curranty finish, but somehow it is still quite round and soft. Intense woodiness in the finish. Spritzy/grapefruit luicy texture, medium carbs. Elegant yet powerful Gueuze. Excellent!

750ml bottle shared with Ben. Aroma: green rippe apples, citrus, dust, funky. App: hazy straw, small white head, subtle lacing. Taste and palate: light body, soft carbonation, medium dry sour and a bit salty finish. Overall: really good. So easy to drink.

Bottle @ Sloan Square, Milan. Pours slightly hazy dark yellow with a small offwhite head. Aroma of sourness, wood, barnyard, horseblanket, dusty notes, grapes, leather, light lemon. Flavor is light sour, barnyard, wood, grapes, dusty, citrus, leather. Medium body, soft carbonation, light acidic finish. 111215
Taster from bottle. Pours a hazy pale brown color with little head. Light and easy going. Great balance of mild sourness and the malt.

Bottle: 2011
Hazy...yellow-gold with a small white head.
Yeasty, lemony, basement aroma.
Tart, nearly bitter flavour...lemon, yeast....musty.....big carbonation.
Champagne-like body.

Dune belle couleur pêche, une mini mousse compacte surplombe le liquide. Au nez, on a affaire à des notes typiques de gueuze mais alors là très concentrées! Le côté citronné et acidulé est très présent. Cela dit, cest loin dêtre unidimentionnel! On retrouve même des efflûves de fruits, de baies : un vrai dessert! En bouche, lacidité est ici aussi poignante. Peut-être une des Cantillon les plus acide que jai goûtée, comparable à la "Cuvée des Champions". Cest une gueuze réussie, raffraichissante, que je boierais à chaque jour! Mais, si on met dans la balance la rareté et les efforts requis pour se procurer ce genre de bouteilles, certaines autres Cantillon gagnent davantage à être recherchées, à mon avis.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2016 Bottle from mikkeller. Pours a golden colour beer with a large head. Green apples and yeast with notes of sour apples. Velvety dry finish top notch vintage 2006

Bottle @ cantillon brussels. Pours a golden colour beer with a medium head. Green apples, wood and brett with some leather. Dry finish vintage 2013

30-OCT-2015, 2003 bottle @Ulkløbben meeting, @Sonni.
Almost clear, golden with low White head. Oxidized, some sherry. Wood, straw. Clearly old and a Little over the top. Aroma is very nice but taste a bit too tired. Thin body, still nice carbonation. Thx. Sonni for sharing this 12 years old treat.

Bottle shared at Darkness Day 2015. No tasting notes entered into my phone, as it was getting quite late into the evening and we had been drinking since about 4pm. I did put numbers down! I remember really loving the sour funk here.

Bottle at Moeder Lambic. Pours a lightly hazy golden, with a lasting white head. Aroma of acetone and nail polish remover (not what I expected!), slighly fruity, grapes. Taste is not as nasty as aroma indicates! Super complex, dry, wood, tart, apricots, apples, funk. Damn, cant believe Im drinking this!

Had I had this a couple of years ago, Im sure I would have rated it +4,2. As it stands right now, there is simpy too much acetone, to rate it any higher than this.
UPDATED: APR 30, 2016 Bottle. Pours light golden with a white head. Aroma of acetone, tart, funk, grape, wood. Barn, lacto. Taste is green Apples, tart, barn, funk. Very complex, Woody.

Just a little big on mouthfeel for guest but splitting hairs. Sour tart and super funky. Hay goat and blue cheese from old cheesy hops. The cheesy hops are such a great dimension only the folks in my old home can do. The olfactory senses of cellar and basement make this a complex and also a well balanced gueze

Pour slightly hazy, light "cantillon amber", with a small fluffy white head. 
Aroma has all that youd want in a gueuze from cantillon, just beefed up a bit. Plenty of horse blanket, yeasty goodness. All what youd like. 
Taste is pretty sour, with a tad of sweetness to it. 
Medium bodied, with a slightly oily texture, and a fizzy carb. Pretty darn delicious.

** Bouteille 2011 ** Une jolie robe dorée voire orangée très voilée est surmontée dune mince couche de mousse somme toute insistante. Les arômes de fond de cave typiques au style sont agrémentés deffluves citronnés et gazonnés. Une acidité citrique, presque champenoise, jamais trop intense, virevolte dans la bouche et laisse derrière elle une finale tannique et sèche. La carbonatation véhémente stimule la grande buvabilité de cette bière. Superbe.

2011 Bottle at Neutnigenough, BRussels
Pours clear copper burnished blonde with fluffy white head. tart, lemon juice and rotting hay on nose. Well carbonated, medium bodied, very sharp at first but as palate adjusts fruity, fairly sweet, earthy, lactic, complex yet clean. musty, complex, zippy, zesty. lovely stuff

Happy to finish the Lou Pepe trifecta with a 2001 Geuze at Zwanze Day at Higobashi Dolphins. 1000 yen for a glass it was a clear deep gold with a filmy head - beautifully clear. The nose is hay, funk and spice. Soft bodied, very tart, sour, acidic, cork and mouth puckering lemon. Lovely but increadibly sour compared to the Bruocsella and Zwanze 2015.

Bottle (2011). Yeasty, musty horseblanket, malt, and straw aroma. Hazy golden yellow with small head. Light sweet-tart lemon, malt, and dry hay flavor. Spectacular balance - nice carbonation. Glorious.
2011 bottle at Holy Grale. Hazy golden with medium white head. Aroma is light tart, light body, medium carbonation, and good lacing. Taste is tart, oak, and earthy. Expected a lot more.

I really dont understand why I didnt enter this rating from 5 months ago... but my phone is on the fritz & Im going through all my old ratings that never got entered.... this was one of them, Im a moron. 
Bottle, courtesy of a chill br, shared in a location remote of my living room. 
Pours a hazy gold with a small but respectable head. 

The aroma is funky & earthy with some light lemon, some oak, and a bit of animal sweat. Its got some hay & distinct barn yard aromas. 

The flavor is lightly bitter, nicely tart with some lemon peel. Its got some musk melon and bright citrus. Its defiantly got a bit of that cheese rind thing happening. Although the brightness, dryness, and white grape defiantly evoke champagne at times. 

The beer is sharp and slightly less lively than I normally expect Gueuze to be, although the beer is carried well by this mouthfeel. 

Great to finally try this, thanks br

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 Vintage 2011. Hazy orange-golden color with white head. It?s got this perfect funk, with wood and tart apples, lemons,something more sweet, pineapples? Taste is more tart apples, cheese, pineapples, lemons, wood. Something special in there. Yup, "vibrant" is the right word. Surprisingly dry-bitter tobacco-like woody finish. Amazing soft foamy carbonation. Yup, this is it. A fantastic Gueuze. Beerporn indeed. This does not have to hide against world-class champaigns.

2005 shared at Zwanze 16. A very delicate one - bretty, pineapples, very balanced, mild, fresh. A Gueuze masterpiece.

Bottle in garden, 6th September 15. 2011 bottle, 2013 cork. Pours lovely and clear, very fine bubbles. Aroma is sweet and sour funk, tart apple. Taste is rich, not overly sour, but good dose of Brett. Tart apple skin, zest, funk, changes as it warms, the lovely base lambic comes through. Classy Cantillon

750 ml bottle to teku (shared with the Mrs. for our 5th Anniversary). 2011 sticker, bottled 30 December 2013. Looks good; a hazy vibrant gueuze orange with foamy white head. Smells and tastes good too; funk, gym socks, and stanky cheese. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied with a nice balance of funk and tartness. Carbonation is spot-on. Stinky, well-balanced goodness.

Aroma of earthy, lemon, small wood, vanilla, citrus, barnyard with a floral background. Lots of flavors, nothing really sticks out, incredibly well balanced and complex, and constantly changing as it warms up. Usually dont rank Cantillons non-fruited offerings very highly, but this is up there.

11 vintage in July 15 with several friends. From sandervdbroek-thanks, Sander! Slightly cloudy straw yellow. Nose starts off with massive funky cheese, jumping out of the bottle and glass until it faded or I became desensitized and it gave way to an almost constant change between lemon pith, limestone, light pineapple, and musty funk. Taste follows with lemon, funky cheese, light cobwebs...initially harshly sour but softening as you get used to it and not an enamel stripper by any means. Makes you want to keep going back for more and contemplating it. Great balance.

500th rated beer.. Gladly rated at akkurat Stockholm, saved for a special one!
2011 Lou Pepe 

Looks.. Murky yellow golden within the darkness of akkurat, sml -med head
Smells... Green apples and lemons, bright farmyard yeasty tarty.
Tastes..Smooth so smooth, green apples lemons, oak/ dry woody and earthy. Sensational

2010 bottle shared by dedollewaitor, thanks a bunch. Hazy golden body with a medium white head. Tart, citric, funky, fruity, green grapes, apples, oak. Crispy, funky, juicy. Very complex. Wow, by far the best gueuze ive ever had. This is truely beerporn. Thanks again Mads.

First bottle at the 24th weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation shared with Rachel & our American friends. Such an impressive selection of lambics. I had to start with something. Pours Gold with a White head. LEmony sour aroma with plenty of funk. Beautifully rounded flavours. Lots of sour, citrus notes. Cant shake the champagne comparison when Im drinking gear this good. Magic.
5 oz pour from a 6 year old bottle. Hazy bronze with thin white head. Lemon, funk, pear, apple, horse blanket. Quite sour, light sweetness. Light crisp body. Trailing peppery aftertaste.

Bottle at Cantillon. Pour is clear copper/yellow with a medium white head of foam. Aroma and flavor of sour apple, lemon zest, oak, slight acidic, and cork. Finish is acidic with light fruit coming through.

Bottle, 2011. Pours a cloudy golden, small white head. Aroma is tart and vinegary, citric and very funky! Fruity, green grapes, peach. Dry and juicy. Taste is very tart. Huge oaky dry notes, vanilla, crisp mouth feel. Sour, funky and complex. Lime juice. Crisp body, average carbonation.

2010 version, shared by oldmanriver. Thanks a lot!
Golden, a bit hazy, medium and instable head.
Aromas of horseblanket, lactic acid, white peach and berries. Strong sourness, very dry, notes of white wine. Full and dry/fruity finish.

2011 750 ml bottle. Pours a clear copper color with a white head of foam. Decent retention. The aroma is juicy funk, medium acidity, fruity and a bit earthy. Im getting some coconut in here as well, which is different, but nice. Softly sour. Oaky. Medium carbonation.
Bottle shared at pre-CBC tasting at Fermentoren. Cloudy bronze pour with tiny lacings. Lots of apple skin, lemon zest, musty oak, some vanilla and some funk.

(Cantillon Lou Pepe Gueuze) 750ml bottle, 2009 sticker from a trade with Abio, thanks! Served into a Cantillon taster, ABV 5%
Bright golden yellow colour on the body, only slightly hazy. Small white head on top, thin and a bit fizzy but with good retention. Minimal lacing on the glass.
Aromas of tart green apples, apple vinegar, grass, light wood, cork.
Great taste, much smoother than their regular. Not very sour, with green apples, funk, light grapes, nicely fruity, with even some bitterness in it.
Medium thin body, carbonation on good levels. Mildly tart palate.
Great stuff.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2015 Bottle shared at Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Pours hazy peachy orange with a medium white head. Aromas of green apples, vinegar, light tannin, fun, straw, barnyward, tart fruits, light cheesy notes. Taste is sour green apples, vinegar, light wheat, funk, peppery notes, lots of barnyard and some tannin.

Bottle to glass at Chez Moeder. Pours a mostly clear golden yellow color with an off white head. Aroma is a huge tartness, touch of funk. Flavor is much of the same. Not as good as the LPF or LPK, but delicious nonetheless.
Bottle. Golden with white head. Fruity, funky aroma. Taste is funky, grapes, wine, peppery. Quite sour

November 6, 2014. Bottle while in Toronto at Bar Volo. Pours a hazy Amber color. Aroma is that funky sour smell, wonderful. Beautiful white head. Taste is smooth and tart, some fruit, earthy. This was great.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Finally got to try this Cloudy amber with a tall white head. Aroma is sour but very controlled. Aroma is rubbery and citrusy with some horse blanket and musty basement/wet earth notes. Tart taste with fruit and some leather. Finish is mnot that tart, surprisingly, but still dry. Not as acidic as a "fresh" gueuze. Awesome beer!

Pours a hazy honeyed apricot with minimal white head and lacing. Aroma is acetic sour and vinous with oak, dandelion stems and musty hay. Taste has a moderate acetic vinegar that blends well and is smoothed out by oak and mild tannic grape skins flavors. Moldy barnyard character and an earthy root vegetable that I cant pin down. Finishes dry with a short sour note. Mouthfeel is semi oily with a light/medium body and lively carbonation. Excellent and mouth watering.

Bottled in 2013. Hazy light honey color with no head. Aroma is acetic, sour and vinegary. Taste is sour and slightly tart. Grapes skins followed by oak. A little musty. Sharp, aged cheese taste as it sits on the tongue. Thin, slightly oily, lively mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

March 21, 2015. Bottle, vintage 2011. 
Hazy orange with a white head. Aroma is funky and tart fruity with citrus, green tart apples, barnyard, leather, horsblanket. Taste is tart fruity, funky, earthy, much smoother than the regular Cantillon Gueuze we had side by side. Fruity tart finish. Light to medium bodied, average carbonation.

750 mL bottle shared by Hamp at Ale Alpharetta. 2011 vintage. Heavy lemon zest, yogurt, orange peel, and light raspberry. Sweet and citrusy, with a good, balanced funk. Medium body, sticky, and crisp. This is fantastic, with a mellow fuzziness.

Pours slightly hazy golden with a fairly thick eggshell head. Strong, sharp aroma is mainly pear and sour apple with a hint of yeast. Delightfully sour-fruity flavor has firm apple, pear and malt notes plus hints of yeast and butterscotch. Texture is lively and firm. Pucker up!

750ml bottle, v2011, shared at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Thanks Douberd for sending this!! Hazy golden orange color with small off white head. Funky aroma, barnyard notes, fruity, tart citrus, wood. Sweet, light bitter, dry light sour taste fruity and barnyard funky again. Light to medium thin to oily body with soft to average carbonation.
2010 bottle, pours pale. Aroma is light dough malt and big oak and barnyard funk. Taste is soft and funky, sawdust, light tart, excellent beer.
Pours a golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is barnyard, lemon and champagne. Taste is lemon, citrus and white grape vinous. Medium carbonation.
HMOG 2015 2010 vintage. Tart, funky (horseblanket and funky cheesy). Flavor is tart apples, funky, whoa, straw, cheesy. Awesomeness.

2010 vintage at HMOG 2015. On another level sour wise. Stinky cheese and super funky aroma. Flavor is incredibly complex and diverse. Earthy and a bit herbal. Tea and grass flavors. Finish is funky and earthy again. A bit dry on the finish.

2010 vintage thanks to _angst_...thanks Alex! Pours a vibrant golden straw color. Lively fizzy white head that breaks into spotty lacing. Nice carb races up the glass. Aromas are insanely inviting! Big sour notes of musty grapes...wet oak...funky blue cheese...burnt rubber...basement...hay...whoa! Lots going on! Taste is fantastically tart and vinious in nature. Loads of oak, barnyard and cheese carry this a long way on my palate. Musty grape, lemon zest and a dry crisp finish make this an outstanding beer that I hope to have again!

Bottle at a tasting at Butler's place. Pours a clear golden yellow with a very thin white head. Aroma is tart apples. Some lime. Some lemon. Flavor follows. Really light and clean. Super nice. This was the 2010. Thanks to Butler. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
So this is geuze, capital G. Horseblanket aroma, sour, but not too much. Slightly astringent. Truly a Great beer-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

2009 bottle, not sure why I never rated this up until now but might as well. Pours a clear golden with a nice white head that fades to a ring in a tall flute glass. This smells so yummy - combination of sour, horse blanket, wet straw, earthy, reminds me of the inside of a wet cave, some lemon zest and a mild cheese funk. Moderate+ carbonation and full fresh body, sour, a bit of tartness, very dry, nice balanced finish with a balanced acidity.
thin white head that dissipates. Nose is big oak barrels, funk, juicy fruit snacks, tart lemon. Taste is funk, very tart pulpy lemon, oak barrels, harsh grains. Lingering tartness and bitterness.

1998 thank you Corby! Pours translucent golden with a nice almost pinkish gray sandy head. Aroma is light subtle sweet white grape yeast notes and some woody flavors as well. The flavor is tart, bitters, yeasty subtle sweetness that go down really smooth on the palate.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 750ml bottle served in a flute glass. Gueuze 2010 Edition bottle.
A: Pours a hazy dark yellow color forming a big and very bubbled fizzy white head with excellent retention. 
Only few lacings formed and left in the glass.
S: Tart and funky nose. Strong notes of pale malt malts and citrus fruits. Grapefruit, white grapes and oak. 
Metallic, lactic and earthy. Leather. Lambic yeasts. Flowery hops.
T: Fruity and tart. Vinegar. White grapes, grapefruit, oak. Sweet malts backbone. Very dry. Metallic notes. Notes of 
leather too. Light hops bitterness. 
M: Light body. Good alive carbonation. Crispy malty and tart aftertaste. 
O: Perfect Gueuze. One of the best Cantillons Ive ever had.
[ BA Review @ 7/8/2014 ]
Bottle from the brewery. Vintage 2010. Orange colour, thin layer of foam. Soft carbonation. Funky and tart. Green apples and citrus. Light bitterness. Complex and very well balanced.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2015 Peach orange pour. Mild funk, minerals on the nose. Taste is mild minerals, big lemon sour, tart bitterness and some grapefruit tang. As it develops in the glass a very slight oaky vanilla comes out on the palate - fantastic. Very drinkable on a balmy hot Brisbane evening; dry finish. Overall, a great gueuze, definitely the best of the Cantillon blends and up there with the crazy good 3 Fonteinen stuff. Wish I had another bottle...

Poured 2010 from bottle to glass. Golden hue with fizzy white head. Aroma is lactic, oak, straw, peppercorn, lemon. Mouthfeel is fantastic with a light body and crisp carbonation. Taste is dry with a tart following and dry spicy finish. Overall this is a great beer!

Thanks to me for the excellent share :V

This beer is insane. Its just so fruity and funky and this is the first time Ive had a bottle less than two years old and its really amazing how lively and fun this tastes straight out of the gate.
Bottle 10 - pours light amber. Sour, tart, oak, and lemon zest in the nose. Tart and acidic taste with lemons and oranges. The balance is so good. Solid beer!!!
Sampled via bottle at WTWBA 2014 in Minneapolis. Golden pour with a smaller white head. Hay and barnyard funk. A little cheese. Spritzy. Awesome beer.

(2010 vintage bottle @ barVolo for Zwanze Day 2014, Sept 20 2014) Lightly hazed pale orange, big white head with no lace. Aroma yeasty, slight green apple, wet hay, faint cheese. Flavour like a champagne with more bitter, barnyard notes. Complex and difficult to describe, acidic at the start but drier and more bitter in the finish. Cheese and brambles and dried herbs in the middle, cider vinegar on the finish. Lightish mouthfeel and creamy soft carb. One of the toughest beers to describe that Ive had, but really lovely to drink. It does remind me quite a lot of champagne, crossed with a lambic, and seemed to have aged quite nicely. I find it more elegant than the normal gueuze. Real thinking beer.
Arômes de vin blanc, mousseux. Saveur de mousseux très amère goût de biere absent

Slightly hazy golden yellow with a good white head. Aroma is old cheddar, dry white wine, barnyard funk, grapes, wildflowers. Light bodied, tart and dry on the palate but in a soft way with no harshness, slightly fruity dry finish. Taste is dry white wine with subtle notes of peach and apricot, mild cider vinegar, lightly citric and floral sourness.
Bottle. Aroma is very fruity, tart, tropical? Sweet. Taste is tart, lots of overripe fruits, easy, light bodied. Great.

750 ml bottle, 2010 year on the sticker, poured at the Tipples Rare and Barrel Aged Beer tasting on July 13, 2014. Nice job, guys!

Pours clear golden colored with a small white fluffy head. Aroma is of the lemon peel and mint leaf kind that I get from a lot of gueuze, some dry dusty oak, funky yeast, very nice. Flavor is pretty funky lacto sour with lemon peels, super dusty dryness, oak, some other citrus notes, hay. Excellent. Like this better than the Classic Gueuze version. Body is very light, with medium plus carbonation and super easy drinking.

One of the three luxurious Lou Pépé lambics from Cantillon, different from the rest of their products by the subtle use of sugar, not for taste (because it is eaten by the yeast completely), but to keep the refermentation going in a very subtle and extremely well-balanced way. This geuze is a bit different also because it exists only of 2 years old lambics (three different ones, if I remember well). Off-white, loose and unstable head, colour warm golden orange, clear but hazy after adding the deposit. Complex and not too agressive, rather sedate lambic aroma, sour apples, grapefruit, white grapes, dry sherry, wet straw, oak, sulphur... Very refreshing in the mouth, elegantly sparkling like champagne (or good old geuze), grapefruity, very delicately sweetish at first but lemony sourness in the middle, finish very long, dry, appetizing and complex like an old dry sherry. Extremely well-crafted, an artisanal masterpiece of great nobility and one of the best apéritif beers imaginable. And one of the best geuzes I ever tasted, even better than the already excellent, but more earthy, Cantillon Gueuze.
Hazy orange with a firm head. Loads of oak, basement funk. Extremely dry and complex. Not overly tart but extremely balanced. Fantastic for the style
750ml bottle at Parker Pie post-FoFA. Pours hazy golden. Lots of funk and a very nice tartness and a perfect gueuze. Would drink a lot of this.

Huge thanks to errl for sharing this bottle, the last one of the Lou Pepes I needed to try. 2009 vintage, drank alongside the 2007 Lou Pepe Kriek. Yellow pour with a white head. The aroma is exactly what I expect from a Cantillon gueuze. I get a lot of funky cheese and feet notes, as well as some yeast and biscuit malt. The flavor is the same. I get some oak and dusty character in addition to the barnyard funk and funky cheese. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Lou Pepe beers never disappoint, and the gueuze lived up to everything I thought it would be. A truly world-class beer that all beer lovers should try.
Bottle..Pour is golden with a fading head..Nose is old feet cheese, dry, oak, grass, musty cobwebs..Taste is tart, sweetness, spice, lemon, musty, horseblanket..

Bottled in February of 2013. 750 mL bottle at Parkers Pie in Vermont. Remarkable. Pours a cloudy amber with aromas of barnyard funk and fruit. Flavors of fruit, oak and spice are enveloped in tart funk. A beautiful beer.

Bottle thanks to Kraddel. Shared during the Homer "welcome to California" tasting. Pours clear butterscotch, small off-white head, decent lacing. Aroma is all Cantillon basement funk, barnyard. Flavor is surprisingly lightly funky, with just a light tartness behind it. Lots of oak. Very dry. Light body, spritzy carbonation. Highly drinkable, but not really complex.
Clear golden color. Funky, mineral aroma. Similar flavor plus dry cider character, grapefruit. Drinks like a hoppier white wine.

Cloudy gold pour with a single finger white head. Lots of carbonation. Aroma of sour fruits and a little vinegar. Really nice full mouth. Sour apple, fruit rind, slightly briny. Apple juice creeps in and out. Very easy to drink and super complex.

Bottle sampled a few times. Recently @ RBWG. Pours a hazy orange tinted dark golden color with a medium plus sized white head. The aroma and flavor have barnyard funk, tart/sour citrus and pear, yogurt, acidic, white wine, wood, dry, sour grows but this remains very drinkable throughout, it is appleasure to sample beers done the right way.

Pours hazy blond, big white head

1999 vintage. 750 bottle. Cloudy golden color with an small head. Funky, yeast, barnyard, some light vinegar, and citrus. Not overly puckering - subtle yet complex.

2009 vintage, bottled in 2011, received in trade, split with my bride. Pours a clear amber color with a white head that fades quickly. Aroma is oak, lemon, grass, a little musty. Medium on the palate with light, soft carbonation. Flavor is lightly sour, some lemon, oak, with a tart, dry finish. Excellent.

Bottle from 2003. Yes, 2003. I thought it was going to be horse pee and vinegar. To our surprise...it was still delicious. Poured into small snifters, the head was extremely mild. Slight ring was about all. The aroma was fairly traditional with the wild yeasts penetrating, soft fruits like white grapes and pears, and a funky horse barn as well. The taste was amazingly good. (Not sure what to expect.) The fruits and funky still came through nicely. I think the edge had worn off of the sourness some and it was slightly muted compared to more modern Guezes from Cantillon. But overall it was really fun to drink an 11 year old beer. Finish was clean. Great carbonation still. Very light body of course. Finish was sour and fruity at the same time.

Bottled. Pours hazy, deep golden with a small, white head. Aroma of white wine, grapefruit notes, brett and barnyard. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry and tart. Light to medium bodied, watery texture and soft carb. A very nice Sour.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2015 2008 bottle thanks to mrebeks for sharing. Cloudy pale yellow pour with a big foamy head that fades and leaves some nice lacing. Aroma is super funky and musty, big barnyard, light cheese, light sour lemon. Tastes delicious. Probably the smoothest gueuze Ive had yet (though this is only my 6th one). Funky, lots of barnyard, just the right amount of sourness for me. Solid tartness in the finish. My favorite gueuze so far. Thanks Mike!

Bottle at home. Vintage 2008. Pours a hazy orange colour with a small, off-white head. Classic aroma of horse blanket, citrus, rowanberries, oak, wheat, vinegar, heather and forest bloor. Sour flavour with a touch of barnyard and apple cider vinegar. Has a slick mouth feel, and a light berry bitterness. A solid and well balanced gueuze.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2015 2011 bottle. Pours a very pale yellow orange with a small light tan head. The smell is funk sand door, lemon, citrus. The taste is very sour citric, very tart and sour ending..dry too. Light body and silly with active fine carbonation. Great stuff!
shared bottle with a friend. poured a more amber colour with a white head. sour apples, barnyard, grapes, tart, apricots, hay, oak, amazing taste! and so balanced! this is how it should be!

Sample from a 75cl bottle at In de Wildeman, kindly shared by Kermis, thanks Chris. 2006 vintage. Murky golden colour, thin white head. Aroma of barnyard, funk, lemon, hint of faeces, a bit dusty. Flavour is mild sour, lemon, funk, some dirty yeast, apple, wheat, tart finish. Light-bodied. Better than expected.
Poured a clear yellow with minimal head. Aroma of zesty fruit. Medium body, very tart. Refreshing, pretty excellent geueze.

shared @ DE-CH-F TriStateTasting, with special thanks to Oldmanriver!
aroma of dry cider and apple vinegar, taste is green apples, and a lot more sour things I dont really feel I have them on my radar, sour-bitter finish. Complex in a way. Hmhm...
2009 vintage. This is a highly carbonated, lively gueuze with a barnyard funk. Dry and sour. A unique beer.

Des fibres de chair de citron éclatées, des herbes humides au fond dune grange, une richesse acétique et des bretts apprivoisés par des tanniques à la poigne de chêne. Un liquide immensément complexe et balancé, japprouve les assemblages de lambic 2 ans.

A bottle from 2003. Orange hazy looking beer with nice and delicate head on top. Aroma has sourness, white wine, zesty green apples and some more sourness. Taste has sour green apples, some mint(?) and white wine. Body is full and has very high carbonation. A really sour gueuze from Cantillon, well preserved for many years. Would like to try more from other years and see which one is the best. Magnificent beer nevertheless.

1999!!!!! A beer from another millennium. Amazing, puts perspective on the rest of the Epic Sours at this tasting. Huge Cantillon bretta yeast flavour. Grapefruit zest and sour wonderfulness. If only Id drank this in 99 when I was young impressionable punk drinking molsen and kokanee. Big thanks to Maniac at Epic Sour Tasting.

Bottle (1999 vintage) shared at DC Annual Epic Sour Tasting, thanks maniac! Golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of floral notes, barnyard funk. Tastes of big bitter tart notes, puckering sour notes. Medium-light bidy with a dry finish. Seems to have aged well.

From a bottle shared at the DC Epic Sour Beer Tasting. Vintage 1999, served in wicker basket (just like Akkarat in Stockholm) Thanks maniac! Pours a clfear gold with an off white head. Funky hay and alfalfa nose. Bandaid and earthy notes. Tart, tart finish. Classic and classy!
1999 bottle. Thanks maniac! Poured a hazy yellow color with a wispy head. Aroma was nice tart notes, sweet fruits. Flavor was sweet tart notes. Fantastic after 15 years of age.

Pours a deep yellow-orange with minimal head. Aroma is a very mixed and muddled affair of the usual lambic old hops, mild lactic acid, barnyard with unusual Cantillon off notes of rotten peach, old cidre, even some overripe banana. Taste takes up many of these disparate notes, making for a rather unharmonious blend of the citric sour and the overripe, dust and fresh lemon peel, white balsamico and quite some residual old hop bitterness. Bottle, vintage 2010 @ The brewery. Noteably more developed than the regular gueuzes, still I prefer the roughness and less structured whole of the same. Much barnyard and funk with a developed sourness, musty wood and hay.

2005 vintage, pours hazy into a tumbler. Shared by Steve, thanks! Super barnyard aroma with little head retention and little lacing. Bottle from recent trade just released. Front label reads 2010 back bottled February 22 2013. Pour has a clean golden color with a fizzy one finger cap of white foam that fell right off and tried to keep a ring on the glass. Bottle of 2010 vintage, shared at the brewery. Pours a hazy white-peach color. Aroma is fantastic: peaches, lemon, sour cherry, hay, Brett. Taste is orange, peach, lemon, grains, grapefruit pith, long finish. Great.

Pours a golden slightly unclear beer with a small white head. Smells cork, medium sour and somw fruitiness. Tastes nice sour, cork with a jice little sweet finish. Average carbo, thin body and a bit dry and watery texture.

Bottle @ proeftafel Van Moll. Slightly hazy yellow with no head. Smells brie, moldy, funghus, cork. Tastes sour, fresh, fruity. Medium body, soft carbo, lasting taste.

2009 or 10 version, all a blur at this point. Poured a hazy yellow with a whisp of head. Nice funk cheese aroma and taste but needs time to develop. the 2001 version in comparison was superior.

RBWG14 Trip Rating #109. Bottle shared by deyholla at the Grand Tasting. Thanks! Pours a hazy orange color with a thin creamy white head. Good head retention. Aroma of tart citrus, floral notes, earth, bright funk. The taste is tart citrus, citrus candy, berries, mild funk. Medium bodied.

Golden, thin white head that dissipates. Nose is big oak barrels, funk, juicy fruit snacks, tart lemon. Taste is funk, very tart pulpy lemon, oak barrels, harsh grains. Lingering tartness and bitterness. Watery mouthfeel, very dry.

2010 vintage. Hazy orange with very little head. Aroma is funkier than the regular gueuze with less obvious lactic sourness. Taste is barnyard, lemons, hay. Some spritz but again less so than the regular version.

text: [Bottle / 2008 / 5+ years old] Turbid, orange-y & burnt yellow body, about 99% opaque & topped with a creamy, smooth, slightly off-white head the slowly descends into a collar. Beautiful Cantillon aroma; funky cork critters, wet bales of hay, Lemonhead candies, mild lactic acid, a touch of vinegar, & green apple sourness. Horse-y, barnyard funk aromas grow stronger with warmth. Taste is wonderfully complex, even more so than the aroma. Lemon, tart lacto, musty cork, barnyard floor, hay, sour stone fruits, light acidity, some orange flesh, a small kiss of vinegar, & a strong, dry, woody oak presence in the finish & aftertaste. Not as sour as the Original Gueuze, & not as funky as the Cuvee de Champions... this is a nice mix in between. Wonderfully balanced between sour & funky with no notable stomach burn. Awesome!

pours unclear pale golden with a small aerial white head, some retention and lacing. white grapes, apricots, some citrus - nice fruitiness, mostly lactic/acetic - acidity profile feels somewhat linear, woodsy and lightly astringent notes, herbal-grassiness. moderate carbonation - could be brighter, light body - oily, bone dry and quite tart grassy-herbal finish. not funk-plenty but definitely there. gueuze bio first.

Bottle share thanks to Homer321. 2009 Sticker. Pours a fairly clear golden yellow color. Big funky barnyard aroma, tart, fruity, sweet tarts. Big tart, funky, barnyard deliciousness. Not the most sour gueuze/Cantillon Ive had but still tasty.
Bottle share thanks to homo! Pours a cloudy orange and yellow. Aroma is barnyard funk, tart. Taste is sweet, tart, yummy... In my tummy...
UPDATED: JUL 12, 2014 Bottle shared by mike at the byte palace. Nose is slightly tart and funky with some cheese. A light saltiness. Some acidic but still lightly sweet.
Had at a tasting. Fantastic sour and like nothing I have ever had. It was like a smoky sour.

2009 bottle. Nice sour lactic nose with hay, lemon, and a light grassy note. Pours a clear golden with no head. Refined taste with a very sour bite early featuring light citrus and vinegar. Very prickly mouthfeel. Good, but I prefer the Classic Gueuze.

Rating #5000! 2009 Vintage. 750mL bottle, sent to me by Glouglouburp (thanks a lot, Dany), pours a clear golden with a small white head. Nose brings out loads of barnyard funk - much more so than the regular Classic Gueuze - along with the usual Cantillon lambic acidity, and some champagne yeast - very exquisite on the nose. Flavour reveals how this is truly Cantillons finest gueuze (even more than Crianza Helena I think, though its close) - there are notes of barnyard funk, moderate acidity, a touch of champagne character, and wood. Absolutely no residual sweetness, of course - it feels even dryer than other typical Cantillon offerings. Extraordinarily complex - a much different beast than the Classic Gueuze. What a gueuze masterpiece this is.

Appearance: Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, No Head, No Lacing

Taste: Hay, Apricots, Mild Lactic Acid

Mouthfeel: Poor Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Bitter
Had a 2000 and 2009 side by side. This is based of the 2009. Pours gold, big funky nose. Light tart, sours. One of best guezes ive had.

Poured from 2009 750ml bottle, pours a hazy dark yellow golden with a thin white head with lots of tiny bubbles, the aroma has a good amount of fruit and funk on the nose, the flavor starts dry with a tart finish, carbonation and mouthfeel is pretty much perfect, not overpowernly sour by any means and just really drinkable.
Hazy golden color with white head. Nice sour aroma. At taste is sour with frizzy carbonation and some floral flavour.
2008 750mL pours a clear golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is fruity with slight Brett yeast, with slight pepper and wood. Very bright yeast, fruits, dry, with slight pepper. Awesome!

Bottle at home with friends. Pour is slightly hazy golden with a small white head that quickly dissipated. Big funky, oaky, citrusy, lemony, urine, tart fruity, light peach, pears, and green apples in the aroma. Taste is very smooth and funky, not too heavy on the sourness, though still tart. Lemony, somewhat grassy, very funky, urine, oaky, and floral. Light body with soft carbonation. Really nice gueuze and a real treat to try.

750ml at Stephan the fucking tickers house. Pours light neon orange with almost no head. Aroma is funky, tart sour, cat piss, water, delicious. Taste is mildly tart, citrus, light to medium acidity. Well balanced gueze, very drinkable and nice. The light acidity and balanced tartness makes it a beer I would drink every day.

Thanks to drowland for awesome bottle share. 

Wow. Beautiful, subtle beer. 2009 vintage. Light gold pour, minimal head. Lemon-sour aroma. Some vinegar and green apple. For a gueuze, it had a very fruity taste. Quite a bit of acidity and touch of funk, but very pleasant. More of a body than I expected. My first Cantillon...hope I get to try more.

(bottle, rating #3000) pours a slightly hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of earth, lime and pepper, with subtle notes of herbal hops, light strawberries, white bread, yeast, old gouda and rose pettles. flavour is slightly more brash and medicinal, with bigger notes of herbal hops, lemons, some rosehip tea, potato skins and a medium sourness in the bone-dry finish. medium-bodied with soft but lively carbonation.
Bottle 0.75l at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Vintage 2006. Colour is cloudy light orange with small white head. Fruits, berries, some sweetness and sourness. Quite juicy, soft and gentle.

2009 Vintage. Pours a golden orange color with a trace of white bubbly foam. The nose is funky basement funk, leather, wet wood, musty stonefruit and tight lemon citrus undertones. The palate follows with lots of barnyard brett character of horse barn and grassy field notes, musty basement and underipe stone fruit. Lots of tart sourness grapefruit rind... really drinkable and delicious !

Bottle courtesy of cparles, shared at Sante Adairius. 09 vintage. Pours a bronzed gold with a froth of white head. Nice musty aroma, as with any good gueuze. Dead wood after rainfall, premature grapefruit, old cheese, straw, barnyard, sour fruit. Really nice. You can definitely tell there is no young lambic in this -- its just so woody and rustic.
UPDATED: APR 23, 2016 Delicous smooth gueuze. The dry sourness is a accompanied with a gentle freshness. Very, very good.
Sampled at a recent tasting. 03 vintage I believe. This was just pure bliss in a glass. Super sour and tart. Seems to have held up very well over the years. Cantillon just does it right!

Bottle shared at CBC Clerkenwell - London. Huge thanks to Bruce (pretty sure it was Bruce!) for the Caantilloon. Pours hazy gold with a creamy, white head. Clean grassy aroma, some definite funk. Light sweet flavor with sweat, grassy bitterness, wet wood, out-of-use cobwebs. Light bodied with average, massaging carbonation. Great tang on the finish, plenty of sour bite, more sweat and that classic, grassy Cantillon bite. Quintessential.
Bottle at Nuetnigenough, Brussels. Orange colour with a small quickly vanishing head. Sour fruit, berry aroma. Flavour is sour, acidic with fruit. Dry finish.

Bottle @ a recent bottle share... Poured hazy golden amber with a thin, bubbly head. Not as funky of a nose as other Cantillon Gueuzes I have had. Musky, earthy, woody, brett-like funk along with some cheezy tones and acidity. Earthy, spiced yeast notes in there too. Wood along with some wine-like notes in there too. Tart in the finish.

Original review 11-07-09. 750ml 2005.

Pours a hazy orange/yellow with a white fizzy head. Funky tart/sour barnyard notes, horse blanket, musty Cantillon-esk notes as well. Some sweet fruit notes in there as well. Not quite as funky as I was hoping, but very solid. Much similar to the nose. Fresh fruit, tart/sour notes, funk, sour apples, maybe some peaches in there as well. Light and fizzy carbonation. Very much like champagne.
8th July 2013Craft Clerkenwell tasting. Light haze on this gold beer. small white head. Medium sourness - typical gueuze woody dried fruits. Little winey sourness. Light dry finish. All right.

Bottle 750ml [2009 Label]
Pours slightly hazy blond with low white head. Aroma is of old shoes, highlighter, fusel alcohol or something like that. Taste is of acid acetic, vegetal stuff, sourness. Palate: Ligth-medium body. Overall: A weird, but OK gueuze. Enjoyable in small quantities. [Note: Drank last as part of a blind tasting. I guess at that point the tasters were a bit gueuze-saturated, but still I dont think this one equals stuff like 3 Fonteinen]

Pours a bright yellow with a decent size white head. The aroma is filled with citrus peel, funky earth, and a touch of wood. On the palate it's really sour obviously but there is some great bright lemon juice flavor in there that's very distinct. Refreshing despite the pucker. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2015 Bottle (750 ml). 2009 sticker. Hazy straw color with a low white head and little lacing. Aroma is of funk, lemon, barnyard, light green apple, grapes and oak. Taste is slightly sweet and moderately sour with funk, barnyard, oak and light fruitiness. Mouthfeel is dry. Light to medium body. Moderate carbonation. A good Gueuze, but far from expectations. It was sampled with 6 other Gueuze in a blind tasting and was far from the best... it was the last though, so Ill have to try it again.

bottle at Matts .. . 2008 bottle .. . lou pepe means goodness .. . quite a balanced gueuze . .. deep yellow.. solid foam ... mild tartness, solid all around .. .  A run-on sentence is pretty much like exercise right because if so I am in pretty good shape pelicans are stupid.

Vintage bottle at Akkurat, thanks Sean!
Pours amber with a few bubbles on top.
Very drinkable, balanced tartness, lemons, grapes and some oak.

Pours a hazy golden with little white head that disappear quickly and no lacing. Aroma of funk, barnyard, green grappes, vinous, lactic. Taste has a very bright acidity, funk, vinous, oak, lactic. Low body and bright carbonation. Different than the classic Gueuze but not better.
Bottle 2008. Color bright orange with small head. Aroma grape, lemon, fruits. Taste sweet, acid, sour, grape.

2008 vintage from Winter Secret Santa. Pours golden orange with small white head. Aromas of musty grapes, lemon tartness, and some barnyard. Flavors of acidity, barnyard, and mustyness. Nice balanced flavor. Would like a touch more tartness but this damn good.
2008 bottle. Bright yellow with slight carbonation. Clean flavors with some lighter toe jam funk and citric. Great gueze!
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: 2002 Vintage drank in 2012.  This was a birthday gift from a good friend of mine in Seattle sometime in 2007, and put down for another 5 years - glad we waited.  Upon opening you get a funky old blast of barnyard and must up the nostrils.  Still lightly carbonated, enough to create a small white head above the light orangey brown color in the glass.  As it hits the lips you can sense the age of the brew, calling your name out, stoked that it is about to finally be consumed.  Funk, must, acid, grass, Earth and dirt...all blended with a beautiful hint of wood buried underneath...lip-smacking excellence right here folks.  All this spirals down into one solid flavor that lingers on the palate for moments and moments after each sip.  I could drink this every day if the opportunity arose.  The true champagne of beers.  An amazing, gift, thank you Matt!  Definitely one of the highlights of my beer consumption career!

A celebratory beer to celebrate the vacations start, thanks me! Pours a lite golden with an artificial head created by the somewhat vigorous pour that disappears on sight. Aroma is classic gueuze with lactic acidity and a bit of barnyard. A lot less than expected, though. Taste is bone dry and softly sour, quite elegant. Mouthfeel is OK with spritzy carbonation. Flavors are once again more lactic than wild but ever so drinkable! A really classy brew!
Golden with small white head.  Quite tart and lemony and pretty nice.  Very drinkable gueze.  Would love to try it with some age.

2009 bottle from Dranken Geers, consumed all by myself at home cos Ive had a knackering week at work - 02/05/13.
Moderately hazed golden with no head, small bubbles dance from bottom to top.
Nose is musty wooden drawer, lemon rind, light sugars, soured grape skins.
Taste comprises lemon rind, damp wood, grape skins, musty damp wood, burnt Tizer.
Medium body, light spritz, dry finish.
A more than decent gueuze.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 2007 sticker bottle @ Grote Dorst. The pours deep goold with a small white head. The nose is grape must. Cobweb-filled attic. Some brett and regurgitated lemon sherbet. The taste is intensely tart. Plenty of tart lemon candy and mild bile. Nice pillowy brett accents and balancing yogurt. Pretty aggressive, but pleasing nonetheless. Light body, full carbonation. Overall, quite good stuff.

Bottle shared at Hunhapu day, poured a light yellow color with aromas of light lemon, some wet oak, and some barnyard funk.  Flavors are the same, light tartness throughout, refreshing overall, thanks to the person who brought this and shared this amazing beer.

Bottle at Jimmy's no 43. Sour, tart. Slightly sweet and acidic. Extremely balanced. One of my favorites

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Una delle migliori cantillon, il blend di tre lambic differenti ne smussa gli spigoli donando rotondità e piacere nella bevuta.
Noledge! Hazy yellow white head super funky aroma. Super sour good carb barnyard sour funk extremely drinkable and I want more!

Opened on my 9 year anniversary with my fiancé. 08 sticker vintage. Pours a hazy, light yellow orange in color with two fingers worth of spritzy white head. Nose is soft lemon rind, mineral, oak, yogurt, and wet stone. Taste is much of the same with a heavier yogurt character and apricot. There is a fair amount of aged cheese and vinegar as well. Light to moderate mouthfeel, moderate acidity, gentle carbonation, and an enduring finish. A good gueuze from Cantillon, but I still prefer the Classic/Bio/etc. I will admit this is much more complex than I remember, I would love to see how this is with 8-10 years on it.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 Blind tasting off 18 current available Gueuzes (this one is a little less current, but we came across it a the local store when buying). Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: nice head, yellow.
Nose: hop, sour and dry.
Taste: tart, very complex, long lasting sourness in your mouth, nice and dry finish.

2008 vintage tasted blind. Pale yellow pour with a thin white head. Nose is light and lemony, yogurty with a nice vinegary tartness. Taste is the same, really tart, but its cut enough to smooth it out and make it very easy drinking. Smooth and softly carbonated. Beautiful beer.

bottle alone @ cantilon. 
pours light orange, little white foam. fades rather fastsmall is realy complex, taste is typical cantillon , but extremely balanced . youd almost think this was barrel aged  on something realy fancy ( like LH 12 was balanced, so is this ! )  its very good, but it isnt groundbreaking to me

Sampled blind with 8 other gueuzes.  This was far and away my least favorite.  Tasted like sulfer and pickle juice.  Body was very very light almost no carbonation and the only one that appeared crystal clear in apperance.  This was pretty vile to drink.
In the gueuze off, no one was a fan of this, gunpowder and sour apple juice, oops

2002 sticker 750 ml bottle generously shared by cpferris.  Big thanks to Chad.  Pours a clear amber with a small white head that settles to a ring.  The aroma is super funky.  Lots of must.  Grapefruit, mushroom, forest floor.  The taste is quite tart and funky.  There is grapefruit, lemon, and apricot.  The Finish is very tart and funky with some oak and a bit of astringency.  Medium body.  Low carbonation.  Quite great.  Possibly the funkiest beer Ive had.

December 29, 2012 - bottle at Bretts tasting. Cloudy yellow pour with some head.  Citrus lemony and the funk in aroma and taste.  Nice clean finish, another well made brew from Cantillon.  2008 label.  Thanks Brett!

750ml bottle from a trade, shared with jsprime, joel, and scottatron. 2007 vintage. super hazed golden, white head. quite a bit of decay in the nose, a bit corky, super funky, not overly sour. flavour is lovely. perfectly aged out gueze, really funky and bret, well integrated acid, endlessly complex. really nice bottle of gueze.

Bottle at home, 2006 version. Clear golden colour with very little bubbly head. Aroma is sour, flat creaminess, nice fruitiness, nice mustiness too, horse blanket! Taste is lovely. Bit of citrus, creamy, bit herbal, touch of grapefruit, gooseberry maybe. Initial sourness, then the creaminess, then musty and bit sour finish. Really nice. Perfect for my Xmas day treat. Cant really beat it.

Bottle. 2008 vintage. Thanks to Ajen for sharing this. Big funky, barnyard, and manure aroma. Cloudy, honey color. Wonderful huge sourness in initial -- but not a shocking one (rather, its had the sharp edges taken off by the aging); lemon and a sort of stewed citrusy note in mid; the final is tangy lemon peel zest. Thin body. Goes down so smoothly. Matured very well. Great stuff.
2008 bottle. Lovely stuff. Nose is leather and old books, flavor mildly sour, some tart lemon, but nice light malty sweetness as well. Wonderfully smooth and complex, maybe the best geueze Ive had?

2007 vintage - bottled in 2009. Pours hazy golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of classic geueze sour, tart and barn. Taste is light sweet and heavy sour with a very dry finish. Body is medium, texture is thin, carbonation is soft to fizzy

Pours a hazy gold with no head. Aroma of oak, funk and vinegar. Tastes dry funky with some oak. Not bad but not my favorite

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden colour, white head. Aroma of apricot, peach, very fruity, citrus, lime peel, light brett, light hay. Light acidic flavour, light bitter, slightly sweet, tart lemon peel. Long, peppery finish, lemon and lots of lime.
Really nice brew. Not as acidic as the classic Cantillon Gueuze, but still very much in style. Very accessible, though I think I still prefer the other one.
(75cL bottle @ home, shared with friends. 2009 vintage. Bottling date 27 Dec 2011. Im confused now ;)
Pours a hazy and amber beer with a white head. The aroma is tart and sourness. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is sour. Overall a good beer.

Bottle from etre gourmet.

Great geuze alot better than the regular one. Think this one will age very well.
Had this one with a clean palate. Wow it is tasty. Very nice mouthfeel, zippy sour flavor. Funkiness is there plenty of lemon sourness as well.

750 ml bottle. Vintage 2008. Hazy amber. Small white head. Nice barnyard nose with grains and lemons. Chewy and flavourful malt flavours mixed with a nice dosage of lactic acid. Very drinkable, and works really well as an aperitif. Apricots and lemons. Very nice.

Bottle shared by esp0r at our #1000 rating celebration. Golden body, low offwhite head, turns to just small lacings. Aroma of berries, mandarin, mushrooms, oak. Taste is very sour, lemon, apples, with wood and sourness is balanced by vanilla and cheese, a really interesting beer. Good refreshing dry and a bit acidic finish

Bottle. 2003 Vintage. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and hoppy powerfull sour aroma. Citrus notes. Really great. MOderate bitter very nice sour flavor. Long complex wonderfull finish. Creamy palate.

2008 vintage bottle shared at the daje & esp0r hits #1000 rates sessions
Pours golden hazy with a small white head. Cork is heavy soaked, but that does not seem to have ruined the gueuze in any way. Smells mostly of funky brett, tart fruits and berries. Some malts in the back. Light sweet, quite dry, nice sourness, alot of berries and apple and some rubber in the back. A very solid gueuze, nice blended, As for the Lou Pepe series i prefer the Kriek though

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2014 I have had this a lot of times and the taste differs a lot between a aged LPP and the "fresh" bottles. 

there is a lot of fresh floral notes in the younger ones. a nice beer that shows itself well in the fresh state. a beer to be consumed in big glasses! of course there is a lot that reminds of the classic geuze, but the complexity level is higher! 

A clear tone of swamps and wet dog in the older bottles. complexity have obviously still been present. Ive had some bad luck and got mostly oxidized bottles although its not always been the case. however they have been stored well when I almost just devoured them on akkurat

consistently, they have been sour, but most of all the complex taste is what to me makes Lou Pepe so special (and tasty).
Lys gylden farge, nesten ikke skum,sour alene som smaker litt umoden stikkelsbær og rips, bitter ettersmak.ganske mild

Bottle @ home vintage ´08 shared with Karin.....It pours hazy golden with a medium white head..... The aroma is earth, sour, wood and some herbal notes..... The flavor is nicely sour, fruits like citrus, wood and acidic finish....nice sour finish..... like it a lot! ...

Bottle at Akkurat. 2002 on the bottle, 2004 cork. Clear, light amber liquid with medium white head. Aroma of lemons, sweat, barnyard, apples, herbal funk. Really complex, great stuff. Taste is dry and medium to high sour with notes of funk and apples. Medium bodied with light to medium carbonation. Great beer.

750 c&c at Poechenellekelder. 2008 Gueuze served via basket! Pours hazy light orange gold with a 3 finger creamy white head. Sour aroma indeed. Med body. Flavor is perhaps light pitted fruits. But the main thing is the sour. Which is very smooth. Finishes just a touch earthy and nicely tart. Quite tasty.

750ml Bottle. Appearance is clear orange color with light, fizzy head. Aroma is stringent, some alcohol, orange, wood, and barnyard musty. Taste is much milder than regular Cantillon Gueuze, slightly acidic with favors of orange rind, cranberry, herbal, and somewhat grainy malt. Palate is medium-bodied, smooth texture, fizzy carbonation, and a dry finish. Much more subtle and easy to drink than a normal Gueuze, this brew is a delight.

2007 Bottle at home, from my Tilquin tumbler. Thanks Riley!!! Pours cloudy deep lemon yellow, thin white head, terrible lacing, but its bloody Gueuze, so whatever. Nose is classic Cantillon, big sweaty horse, lemon, funk, earth,  lightly herbal, really aromatic, but I can still smell the malt underneath. Flavours are sweaty, but softer than normal Cantillon Gueuze, Lots of juice and orange, with sticky acid and lovely mustiness. Gorgeous stuff.

Bottle shared at Moeder Lambic.  Pours hazy golden with a medium white head.  Aroma of big horse blanket and barnyard funk, slightly cheesy qualities.  Flavour is heavy sour, pretty mouth puckering but excellent stuff!
Pours amber with a white head. Aroma is sulphur, leather, grapefruit and light barnyard. Flavour is acidic, sulphur, tart, grapefruit, leather and fruit.

Pours yellowish golden orange with a big fluffy white head. Nose is dusty barnyard funk, earthy soil and grass, with only a slight lemony hint. Very rich though. Taste is very sweet on the front. Slight bitter mixes in with wonderful tartness to make a complex aftertaste. Mouthfeel is crisp and clean, medium body with a wonderful finish.

(750ml bottle 2005 vintage from Novare Res) clearish bright gold-orange, edge and fine white bubbles. Nose of charred wood, cranberry, tart, light funk, wet wood, cheesy, light lemon and orange. Taste of light salty olives, tart without being acidic or vinegary, Lemon, complex and lots of layers. Well carbonated, champagne like.

200A surprise share by Ryan on the last visit to South Florida.  Cheers, sir!  Pours a hazy as hell yellow with a white head.  Nose is lemon, hay, vinegar, funk, and some wood.  Flavor is similar- dry- lemon, tartness, vinegar, wood, and all manner of mouth-puckering gueuze.  Finish is dry with hints of lemon and tartness.  Medium in body for a gueuze and very impressive, even to a guy who is not a gueuze lover.

Im enjoying a bottle of this with my wife while watching a French art film.

2006 Vintage

A: Clear golden hue with a white foam head that fades very quickly, leaving no lacing.

S: Funk, oak, hay

T: A really nice gueuze. Insanely drinkable and enjoyable, with notes of oak, and possibly tart apples and/or lemons.

M: Not as tart as I was expecting. Very smooth feel, with a fairly low carbonation level.

D: Extremely drinkable. It would be quite easy to throw back several glasses.
Great and landmark gueuze.  This was a 2006 bottle which had mellowed nicely.  The sourness is complete and almost cider-ish.  Aftertaste was a bit short.
Sampled at Small Peen tasting.  Very tart funky yeasty complex fruit.  This is vert tart and sour but is also very interesting.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2012 Bottle opened for #4,000, courtesy of pushkinwow. Glad to see Ratman69 so excited to see me rated 4,000 brews! Hazy, golden orange appearance with a small white head. Quite lactic, rich lemon citrusy, vanilla, somewhat woody aroma. Tangy, rich lemon citrusy, coconut, parmesan cheese, rich citrusy, tart lactic flavor. Fairly sour. Pretty good stuff.

Pour out of bottle, 2009, hazy orange-yellow pour with white head, aroma has notes of parmesan cheese, funk white fruit, dirty basement, hints of vanilla.  Taste is lemony biscuit, tart vanilla, biscuit, finishing fairly tart.  Nice funky cheese as well.  Nicely done.

14 karat pour with a wispy ivory head.  Lemon oil, citric acid, musty funk, oak, and horseblanket in this one.  Light, tart, yet pungent...quite refreshing!  Enough carbonation to ignite the palate without being prickly.  Classic!

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2012 Cantillon Lou pepe Gueuze 2009 vintage- Brewed 2007

A - 3 finger slightly yellow head. Faded to one finger then stuck around vanilla color yellow gold. Crystal clear

S - lemon seeds and coriander. Pepper and distiller water. Minor dry yeast scent

T - dry honey. Some biting spices. Oak and a tad bit of cloves. Creamy lemon pie

M - 35% carbonation on swish. Dry and fleeting. Medium body

O - lives up to expectations but maybe too much spice. 94/100

Update: Had an 05 Vintage with friends last night. 

No head on the pour with a small bit of lacing. Still bright and orange as the 09. Smell was a lot more funky, less spices and more fecal in nature. Taste is mind blowing strong. Still hints of lemon and spices but the funk dominated more. Some mahogany and oak at the finish. Totally mouth puckering mouth feel still very dry. Slightly lower rating (4.1) in my notes versus the 4.3 I gave the newer vintage. Just a personal preference that I like this one fresh versus with age on it.

26/V/2012 - 75cl bottle @ WoSF 2012 (Opstal) - 2007 vintage - bottled: 2/X/2009 (2012-546) 
Cloudy amber to orange beer, big aery off-white head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: pretty fruity, sour apples, soft bretta, hay, bit grassy. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: soft mellow wour start, lemony, pretty grassy bitterness, green apples. Aftertaste: very tart, dry crispness, bit like a oaked cider, but then quite some barnyard and bretta coming through.

In bottle at the 21st Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation. Pours a light golden colour with a thick white head. Aroma of lemon, horse blanket, white pepper and oak. Similar flavours and nicely tart with a dry finish. Moderate carbonation and a foamy mouth-feel. Great!

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2015 2009 Vintage (meaning the bottle says 2007) @ WoSF 2012 // a new Cantillon in a long time // 75 cl. bottle split with tderoeck & adamjackson (Tim & Adam) // (a) clear golden with a gauze styled head, head gets huge when poured but quickly goes to the smaller side and remains stable // smell is tart, clean, Cantillon barnyard funkiness, lemon zest & serious amount of hay // not as smooth and fluent as Cantillon, this is a bit start stop flavour, remaining rawer nature of about 1 yr old Cantillon, this beer seems to be going a bit against the grain flavour wise, it works but it grinds and grinds, more of a blend of lambics than a gauze if that makes any sense to others, lots of Cantillon funk, heavy hay, rustic barnyard, fields, bitter with some aged hops bitterness in the finish, touch fruity, touch light apples perhaps, small touch of lactic, inkling of floral & touch of champage, it is quite fizzy carbonated // lasting farmyard & touch old hops bitter finish// good but not Cantillons best for me personally /////// Bottled on 30/12/2013. 750 ml. bottle @ home. Almost clear, dark sparkling orange, small but solid white bubbly head. Thick white pepper funk nose, dried orange peel, thick funk, dry cork, real thick Cantillon funk. Taste is huge oak, huge cellar, very dry, bitter old oak, huge thick Cantillon funk, white pepper, bitter touch moldy dried orange peel, huge cellar, straw, lots of cellar, huge amount, bitter dry oak, Sparkling, cork dry, Lots of cellar. Delicious, might be the age that gave the advantage to this bottle. Absolutely wonderful. 4.2 > 4.8.
